meanings.definition: Having no special or distinctive features; normal.
meanings.sent1: The plain white shirt was ordinarier than the colorful one.
meanings.sent2: She preferred the ordinarier route to work, avoiding the busy streets.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's ordinarier costume didn't quite fit in with the flashy ones.
meanings.sent4: His ordinarier appearance masked his extraordinary intelligence.
meanings.sent5: The ordinarier tasks of the day seemed to drag on endlessly.

meanings.definition: Of a lower standard or quality than average.
meanings.sent1: The fast food restaurant served ordinarier burgers compared to the gourmet diner.
meanings.sent2: Her artwork was considered ordinarier by the critics, lacking creativity.
meanings.sent3: The magician's ordinarier tricks failed to impress the audience.
meanings.sent4: The old car felt ordinarier after driving the luxurious rental.
meanings.sent5: The ordinarier ingredients resulted in a bland dish.
